channel.title: RSC Development
channel.description:
Non-Player Characters are written in BeanShell and include fully replicated questing + exact dialogues. Most of the important NPC's are finished, however there are many still missing.
[img]http://imageshack.com/scaled/large/7/q2s.png[/img]
Minigames.
[img]http://imageshack.com/scaled/large/27/eim7.png[/img]
Skills.
[img]http://imageshack.com/scaled/large/853/5us.png[/img]
24 Quests including tutorial island completed. Tutorial island is the only quest written in Java.
[img]http://imageshack.com/scaled/large/707/wt71.png[/img]
Jagex style sleeping with fatigue decrement
[img]http://imageshack.com/scaled/large/832/jgvp.png[/img]

item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:16, topic:525940”][quote author=CodeForFame link=topic=644684.msg4337915#msg4337915 date=1374682948]

[quote author=imthenull link=topic=644684.msg4337910#msg4337910 date=1374682402]

[quote author=Methods link=topic=644684.msg4337906#msg4337906 date=1374682004]
@Imthenull - Why do you like Groovy? And how easy would it translate these scripts from BeanShell? be to
[/quote]Groovy is basically a less strict (syntax wise) than Java while still retaining the finesse of it’s predecessor. You can look more into here.
[/quote]Why should be Groovy be used over Scala?
[/quote]it’s more user friendly lolol

scala is a good language, too.[/quote]I never understood why people don’t think it’s user friendly… You can write code that looks extremely similar to Java. And it’s not like it forces you to use any “advanced” features.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Methods Methods
item.description:
@Methods wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:11, topic:525940”]Yeah nonetheless it looks like a lot of time was invested into this.

And from what I see(if all those BSH npcs are finished) you’ve certainly done a lot more than anyone else around here.

May I ask what source you are using? I’d of guessed RSCA/Mopar by the minigames.[/quote]

Thanks, yes I have invested quite a lot of time trying to write these dialogues down to perfection, however I understand BeanShell wasn’t the wisest of choices to pursue this. @Imthenull - Why do you like Groovy? And how easy would it be to translate these scripts from BeanShell?

@Waj - I am using DarkQuest as my server base, with the RSCEmulation client. Very modified, however.

Read full topic

May I ask what source you are using? I’d of guessed RSCA/Mopar by the minigames.[/quote]Mopar hasn’t support BSH in quite a while… I’m pretty sure the minigames have also been removed.

item.title: RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“CodeForFame, post:8, topic:525940”]The issue of speed is irrelevant in this case… The wait times are orders of magnitude longer than the execution time.

The problem is that it’s BeanShell and isn’t flexible or readable. For example, you have to be aware of ordering of options and their indices, in addition to defining them upfront. In addition, you have no compile time errors, which is a pain in the ass for new people who are just getting used to statically typed languages and the process for debugging them.[/quote]I agree with you 100%, there are many better scripting languages available that look similar to Java, of which my favorite is Groovy.

[quote=“waj, post:9, topic:525940”]Not to mention, 90% of xEnt’s work isn’t any better looking than something what comes out my dogs ass.[/quote]This too. lol

@OP Good work, looks like you’ve invested a lot of time into this.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @waj waj
item.description:
@waj wrote:

Not to mention, 90% of xEnt’s work isn’t any better looking than something what comes out my dogs ass.

item.title: RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

The issue of speed is irrelevant in this case… The wait times are orders of magnitude longer than the execution time.

The problem is that it’s BeanShell and isn’t flexible or readable. For example, you have to be aware of ordering of options and their indices, in addition to defining them upfront. In addition, you have no compile time errors, which is a pain in the ass for new people who are just getting used to statically typed languages and the process for debugging them.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @Kay_wut Kay wut?
item.description:
@Kay_wut wrote:

Beanshell is slow, I do not see why yours add script engines to Runescape Classic servers. Servers should perform as fast as they can. Not adding library’s and script engines what are slower compared to just using java.

Iterate and setting a random value 10000 times.

Java: 0.14
BSH: 0.99

Stop using script engines, Or maybe write your own what is BUILT for the source you are using and benchmarked to fudge.

Read full topic

item.title: RSC Development
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

[quote=“No Effn Lime, post:4, topic:525940”]Whats wrong with beanshell? Its essentially a shorthand of java[/quote]Not really. It’s an outdated scripting language for Java. I’m assuming he’s using xEnt’s scripting engine which isn’t very good to begin with though.

Read full topic

item.description:

Whats wrong with beanshell? Its essentially a shorthand of java

Yeah, but it has slower performance. Not sure how much it matters here though
